message.content:
cs.LO, cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.PL

The paper deals with the theory of infinite games, which is a topic in theoretical computer science. Specifically, it studies games with infinitely many priorities, which are relevant in several application areas such as pushdown games. The paper also discusses winning conditions and winning strategies, which are concepts that are commonly studied in the subfield of logic in computer science (cs.LO). Additionally, the paper involves the study of game graphs, which are a type of data structure that is relevant in the subfield of graph theory (cs.GT). The paper also involves the study of positional strategies, which are a type of algorithmic technique that is relevant in the subfield of algorithms and complexity (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the synthesis and verification of reactive controllers, which is a topic in the subfield of artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and the model-checking of logics, which is a topic in the subfield of programming languages (cs.PL).
